item.title: Ballad of a Bounty Hunter
item.description: Ballad of a Bounty Hunter is a 1968 Spanish western film directed by Joaquín Luis Romero Marchent and distributed by Troma Entertainment.

item.title: They Call Me Trinity
item.description: They Call Me Trinity is a 1970 Italian Spaghetti Western comedy film written and directed by Enzo Barboni and produced by Italo Zingarelli. The film stars Terence Hill and Bud Spencer as two brothers, Trinity and Bambino, who help defend a Mormon settlement from Mexican bandits and the henchman of the land-grabbing Major Harriman. It was filmed on location in Lazio, Italy, with financial backing from West Film.

item.title: God Forgives... I Don't!
item.description: God Forgives... I Don't! is a 1967 Spaghetti Western film directed and written by Giuseppe Colizzi. The film is the first in a trilogy followed by Ace High and ended with Boot Hill.

item.title: Trinity Is Still My Name
item.description: Trinity Is Still My Name is a 1971 Italian Spaghetti Western comedy film directed by Enzo Barboni. Starring Terence Hill and Bud Spencer, it is a sequel to They Call Me Trinity (1970). It was shot extensively in Campo Imperatore, Abruzzo.
